intro: Sessea crassivenosa, commonly known as the thick-leaved sessea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with showy flowers and toxic properties. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish or yellowish in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often in dry or semi-arid environments. The plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its toxicity requires careful handling.
